key_factors: Coastal chaparral, Santa Ana winds, Wealthy communities in WUI
recent_fires: Woolsey Fire (2018), multiple smaller fires annually
description: Iconic coastal mountains with extensive home development in fire-prone areas.

key_factors: Dense vegetation, Santa Ana winds, Limited access
description: Steep terrain with dense chaparral. High wind exposure.

key_factors: Drought-stressed forests, WUI communities, Mountain topography
description: Mountain communities surrounded by dry forest and brush.

key_factors: Remote areas, Hot, dry climate, Limited fire resources
description: Remote mountain communities with extreme fire weather conditions.

key_factors: Agricultural areas, Dry hillsides, Strong winds
recent_fires: Thomas Fire (2017) - largest in CA history at the time
description: Agricultural valleys surrounded by dry hillsides.

key_factors: Urban-wildland interface, Fast-growing communities, Limited escape routes
recent_fires: Corona Fire (2021), multiple suburban interface fires
description: Rapidly expanding suburbs pushing into fire-prone hills.

key_factors: Dense population, Limited water resources, Narrow canyons
description: Affluent foothill communities in narrow canyons with limited evacuation routes.

key_factors: Mountain communities, Aging infrastructure, Limited water
description: Mountain and desert interface communities with limited resources.
